info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:13PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fayette, northwestern Hardeman, southeastern Haywood and southwestern Madison Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 413 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hillville, or 13 miles northwest of Bolivar, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whiteville, Hillville, Dancyville, Cloverport, Mercer, Medon, Neely, Fayette Corners, Huntersville, Cedar Chapel, Vildo, Hatchie, Uptonville, Teague, Denmark and Leighton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west Tennessee.
